titleStmt.title: Šeher-Čehajina Bridge and Alifakovac in winter

editionStmt.edition: SIBA – A Visual Approach to Explore Everyday Life in Turkish and Yugoslav Cities, 1920s and 1930s

publicationStmt.publisher: Middle Eastern Studies, University of Basel
publicationStmt.authority: Centre for Information Modelling in the Humanities, University Graz

ab.orgName: Alija M. Akšamija private collection, Sarajevo
ab.name: Sarajevski ciklus 1938./39. – Panorame i vedute Sarajeva XXVI

body.ab: View over the Miljacka and Šeher-Čehajina ćuprija towards the mahalla of Alifakovac during winter. The roofs, the bridge and hills in the background are covered with snow. A few people are crossing the bridge. A large poplar tree dominates on the right, hiding part of the Inat kuća just behind. Next to the tree, the minaret of the Vekil Harč Mustafa Mosque lookes very modest in height.

The picture is taken from the same spot as siba.4883. Together they form a negative-diptych. Analogue photographic process, negative-positive (Agfa Isopan 17 DIN). Original preserved as a negative-diptych, stored as a negative and a digital record.

listBibl.bibl: Akšamija, Mehmed A. (2015): Alija M. Akšamija – Monografija arhivografije. Sarajevo: BANU. Vol. I, 87.
